intro: Caroxylon camphorosmoides, commonly known as the camphorosmoides tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and yellow flowers. The tree is known for its aromatic properties, with the leaves and bark containing compounds similar to camphor. It grows in humid, tropical conditions and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique chemical composition, it has been of interest for potential medicinal and aromatic uses.
